In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple implementation of this function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[- ]" => "_")
end
```
The `replace()` function replaces every occurrence of the regex pattern "-" and " " (space) with an underscore. The `lowercase()` function converts the string to lowercase, `strip()` removes leading and trailing whitespaces, and `AbstractString` ensures that the input is a string.
